item.title: Plan to increase youth minimum wage could be delayed
item.content:encoded: Government sources tell BBC News they could slow down plans to make minimum wage equal across age groups.

item.title: Plan to increase youth minimum wage could be delayed
item.content:encoded: Government sources tell BBC News they could slow down plans to make minimum wage equal across age groups.

item.title: Hamilton finds new F1 cars 'more fun' to drive
item.content:encoded: Lewis Hamilton says he finds the new Formula 1 cars this year "more fun" to drive - in contrast to the views of Max Verstappen and Fernando Alonso.

item.title: Children injured by NHS can claim damages for lifetime of lost earnings, court rules
item.content:encoded: The decision from the Supreme Court, on the case of a child who sustained a brain injury at birth in 2015, could have significant cost implications for the NHS.

item.title: Uefa investigates alleged racist abuse against Real Madrid player during Benfica match
item.content:encoded: Benfica claim there is a "defamation campaign" against Gianluca Prestianni as Uefa launch an investigation into claims he racially abused Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr.

item.title: 'Defamation campaign' against Prestianni - Benfica
item.content:encoded: Benfica claim there is a "defamation campaign" against Gianluca Prestianni as Uefa launch an investigation into claims he racially abused Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr.

item.title: Rescuers search for nine missing skiers after California avalanche
item.content:encoded: Forecasters warn that heavy snowfall is likely to continue in the area over the next few days, making rescue efforts more difficult.

item.title: Driver guilty over fatal smart motorway crash
item.content:encoded: Barry O'Sullivan killed 68-year-old Pulvinder Dhillon after driving into a stationary car on the M4.

item.title: GB medal hopes still alive after double win over US
item.content:encoded: Team GB's slim Winter Olympics curling medal hopes are still alive after both the men's and women's rink edge out the United States in Cortina.

item.content:encoded: Team GB's slim Winter Olympics curling medal hopes are still alive after both the men's and women's rink edge out the United States in Cortina.

item.title: How a fatal crash happened on a smart motorway
item.content:encoded: Pulvinder Dhillon, 68, from London, died after the crash on the M4 in Berkshire in March 2022.

item.title: Wave of arrests over killing of French nationalist piles pressure on far left
item.content:encoded: Eleven people are in detention in connection with the killing of far-right student activist Quentin Deranque.

item.title: Watch: Lindsey Vonn shares her journey home after Olympics crash
item.content:encoded: The US skier was the Olympic downhill champion in 2010 and had been hoping for a fairytale ending to her illustrious career in 2026.

item.title: Flooding may worsen as unsettled weather expected to last for at least another month
item.content:encoded: With wet and unsettled weather expected to continue flood affected areas will have to wait longer for any respite as Sarah Keith-Lucas explains.

item.title: USA's Shiffrin wins slalom gold in emphatic style
item.content:encoded: American star Mikaela Shiffrin cemented her status as the greatest alpine skier of all time as she won Olympic slalom gold in emphatic fashion.

item.title: USA's Shiffrin wins slalom gold in emphatic style
item.content:encoded: American star Mikaela Shiffrin cemented her status as the greatest alpine skier of all time as she won Olympic slalom gold in emphatic fashion.

item.title: 'Difficult' Russia-Ukraine peace talks end without breakthrough
item.content:encoded: The second day of negotiations between Ukraine and Russia ended after just two hours.

item.title: Met making 'initial inquiries' into claims about Andrew protection officers
item.content:encoded: It comes after claims emerged that protection officers "turned a blind eye" during visits to Jeffrey Epstein's island.

item.title: Ukraine officials to boycott Winter Paralympics
item.content:encoded: Ukraine officials will "not be present at the opening ceremony" or "take part in any other official Paralympic events" at next month's Winter Games following the inclusion of Russia and Belarus.

item.title: Defence giant BAE hails record sales as workers remain on strike
item.content:encoded: Defence company BAE has increased payouts to investors after its sales increased but staff in Lancashire have walked out over stalled pay talks

item.content:encoded: Gemma Belby says she only found she was paying "double tax" after chatting with her colleagues.

item.title: 'How on earth have they done that?' - see Morrison's miracle shot that stole win for GB
item.content:encoded: Rebecca Morrison hit an incredible shot against the USA to win the game and give Team GB a chance of progressing into the curling semi-finals.

item.title: Otter cubs rescued after sheltering in car engine
item.content:encoded: The tired and cold cubs were taken in for the night by Karen Watson, who kept them in a cardboard box in her bathtub.

item.content:encoded: Scotland have historically flopped in the game after beating England in the Six Nations - lock Scott Cummings says they are determined to put that right this year.

item.content:encoded: Kerstin G's boyfriend is accused of leaving her unprotected and exhausted close to the summit during a blizzard.
